summary: This is a court filing from the United States v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330) where the parties submit a joint letter providing a list of names and places for voir dire. It is a procedural document related to jury selection in Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Appears as the recipient of an email submitting a joint letter regarding voir dire in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Chambers
persons.context: Addressed in the email as the recipient of the attached joint letter from the parties in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email submitting the joint letter on behalf of the parties to the court chambers.

events.title: Submission of Joint Voir Dire Letter
events.description: The parties in United States v. Maxwell jointly submit a letter providing a list of names and places for the voir dire (jury selection) process.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: This document is related to the criminal case United States v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330.
The parties submitted a joint letter containing a list of names and places for voir dire (jury selection).
The document indicates ongoing trial preparation procedures in Ghislaine Maxwell's case as of November 2021.
The communication is from an Assistant United States Attorney to the court chambers.
The attached PDF likely contains the specific names and places relevant to potential juror screening.
